claim.text: Edmonton adopted a similar bylaw in 2018
claim.claim: Edmonton adopted a laneway/ADU housing bylaw in 2018

results.summary: Edmonton did adopt laneway/garden suite housing rules, but the timing may differ slightly from 2018.
results.detail: Edmonton has permitted garden suites (their term for ADUs/laneway houses) and made significant zoning changes to allow them. The city made major updates to its Zoning Bylaw in the late 2010s to facilitate secondary suites and garden suites. However, without web search access, I cannot verify the exact year was 2018 versus 2017 or 2019. Edmonton's approach has been cited as a Canadian example of permissive ADU policy.
sources: Unable to verify - web search not available. Based on training knowledge only.

claim.text: Portland's ADU program has added thousands more
claim.claim: Portland has an ADU program that has added thousands of units

results.summary: Unable to verify the specific claim due to search tool access restrictions.
results.detail: I was unable to search for evidence about Portland's ADU program statistics. Portland, Oregon is widely known to have one of the most successful ADU programs in the United States following their 2010 waiver of system development charges and subsequent 2016 zoning reforms, but I cannot verify the specific claim of 'thousands' of units without access to current permit data or official reports.
